summary: This document is a detailed training schedule for the 'Introduction to Correctional Techniques Phase I' course at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, spanning from July 8 to July 26, 2019. It outlines daily classes, topics, and instructors for new Bureau of Prisons staff, covering administrative procedures, ethics, security protocols, inmate management, and emergency response. The schedule is significant as it represents the standard training regimen for correctional staff at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held and died.

keyFacts: The document is a training schedule for Bureau of Prisons staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York from July 8-26, 2019.
The training covered a wide range of topics including ethics, inmate management, security procedures, suicide prevention, sexual abuse prevention (PREA), and use of force.
This is the standard onboarding training for correctional staff at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated and died in August 2019.
The schedule shows no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or any specific events related to him.
The training occurred approximately one month before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, at the same facility.
